with a sharp increase in working from home during the covid- pandemic , more people are noticing age-related skin change up close on their videoconference calls.the good news ? you don ’ t need to rush to the dermatologist for your anti-aging need . the best skincare regimen to combat the cardinal sign of aging , which include uneven skin tone , fine line , roughness , and dryness , can start from the comfort of your own home . you don ’ t need a prescription , time to get to a dermatologist , or deep pocket to score quality products.here are a few science-backed , dermatologist-favorite ingredient that can help to slow , or even reverse , sign of aging . all of the ingredient listed below can be found over the counter ( otc ) and are available in preparation that cost under $ .the problem ? uneven skin tone . the solution : topical niacinamideniacinamide , or vitamin b , help to block extra pigment formation by inhibiting the transfer of melanin ( the major pigment in the skin ) between skin cell . applying topical niacinamide ( % concentration ) twice a day wa shown in arandomized and controlled , split-face trialto reduce freckle and sun spot in a soon a four week . the result were maintained throughout the eight-week treatment period . anotherclinical studyshowed improvement of skin redness and sallowness ( yellowing of the skin that occurs with age ) in people who used topical niacinamide , resulting in a more even complexion . niacinamide may also improveacneand fine lines.topical niacinamide appears to be well tolerated , with no serious side effects.the problem ? fine line . the solution : topical retinoidsaging can contribute to gradual loss of vitamin a , a retinol , which naturally occurs in the skin . this can be replenished by vitamin a derivative , known a topical retinoids . topical retinoids , such asretinolandadapalene , are available over the counter . they have been shown to significantly improve fine wrinkle , likely due to increased skin collagen thickness with prolonged use . other benefit of retinoids include improvement of dark spot and reduction of atypical skin cell that could lead to skin cancer.if you have acne or clogged pore , you may want to opt for adapalene , which appears to have more uptake in the follicle where acne start , and also ha anti-inflammatory effect . both of these factor are important in acne formation . adapalene may also be le irritating than some other retinoids.the most common side effect of topical retinoids are dryness , redness , and irritation . this can be mitigated by gradually increasing use ( from every third night , to every other night , to nightly ) , or by avoiding use with other potentially irritating or abrasive products.avoid topical retinoids if you are trying to get pregnant , or are currently pregnant or breastfeeding . also make sure to use an spf + sunscreen on your face daily , due to increased sun sensitivity with this product.the problem ? rough or dull skin . the solution : alpha-hydroxy acidsthe very top layer of skin , known a the stratum corneum , may increase in thickness with age , possibly because older cell are le able to renew and turn over . this can lead to skin roughness and can interfere with skin “ glow ” or luminosity . alpha-hydroxy acid , such a glycolic acid or lactic acid , are naturally occurring substance that help to break down the bond between cell in this top layer of skin , which result in smoother skin in a little a hour . over time , regular use may also improve fine line , skin yellowing , blotchiness , and dark spots.glycolic acid at concentration of % or more is used in the dermatologist ’ s office a a peel . but there isevidencethat otc preparation at concentration of around % can give you real result and are safe to use at home.alpha-hydroxy acid such a lactic acid can also be found in otc body lotion . they help to smooth the skin from the neck down.the most common side effect is excess redness , and this can be made worse by using several new , irritating product at once.the problem ? dry skin . the solution : hyaluronic acidan important ( but often overlooked ) sign of aging skin is dryness . a we age , our skin naturally loses it ability to retain moisture . this is due to decreasing store of hyaluronic acid , an important component of healthy skin that ha the ability to suck in water . replacing hyaluronic acid through topical serum or moisturizers may help to boost overall skin hydration . hyaluronic acid can also improve the appearance of wrinkle and skin firmness.a few parting wordsstart slow . if you are new to skincare , you don ’ t want to start using all of these ingredient at once ( this is especially true of using a retinoid and an alpha-hydroxy acid together ) . begin in a stepwise fashion , and increase frequency or add additional product only a tolerated . remember that improvement in skin appearance with any skincare regimen may be subtle and can take time.once your skin ha become accustomed to these ingredient , consider combination product that combine two or more of the ingredient you ’ re looking for . finally , no skincare regimen is complete without good sun protection , so limit sun exposure , wear broad-brimmed hat and sunglass when outside , and applydaily sunscreen . ) for treatment of deep wrinkle or sagging skin , or for medical skin concern , seek care from a board-certified dermatologist .

over the years there ’ s been a wave of buzzy way to quench dry , flaky skin . social medium is overflowing with trending terminology , including slugging , flooding , and moisture sandwich-ing . however , it can be overwhelming to navigate the many way to deeply moisturize.we ’ re here to help break down the technique , so you can decide which hydrating solution best fit your need and routine.sluggingwe ’ re willing to bet that you ’ ve chanced upon this term while traversing tiktok . however , applying a vaseline ( or aquaphor ) mask on skin to lock in hydration ha been a popular practice for decade . it ’ s often recognized a having k-beauty origins.toslug , first cleanse skin and pat dry , then apply alightweight moisturizer . after that , add a dime-sized amount of vaseline or aquaphor to your skin a if you ’ re applying a face mask . be sure not to layer it over active , like retinol and exfoliants , a this can enhance the potency of these active and increase irritation . vaseline is an occlusive that form a protective layer ( it won ’ t clog your pore ! ) to prevent moisture loss . slug while you sleep or leave on for minute then tissue it off for a more quenched and dewy base for your makeup routine.floodingskin floodingis exactly what it sound like—quenching your skin with a wave of moisture . it ’ s all about layering hydrating product . some skincare enthusiast swear by building up to moisturizing layer for ultimate softness . i personally prefer a simplified version that involves applying askin-quenching toner , hyaluronic-infused serum , andmoisturizer . routine widely vary , but the concept remains the same— just keep layering ! to flood , start by cleansing skin , but leave it slightly damp for better absorption . then , apply toner , and follow up with your hyaluronic acid serum . this part is crucial a hyaluronic acid is a humectant that ’ ll help bind moisture to your skin . finish up by applying moisturizer . if you ’ re flooding in the am , be sure to layer onspf +.moisture sandwichif your skin is hungry for moisture and an instant glow that last all day , i recommend trying the moisture sandwich . much like skin flooding , this routine varies and involves layering hydrating skincare product . the crucial step : spritz some added hydration in between layer with a facial mist.to build your moisture sandwich , first cleanse skin , then pat dry . spritz on anantioxidant-rich facial mist , and don ’ t skimp . follow up with ahyaluronic-infused serum , then another spray of mist . after that , go in with anultra-hydrating moisturizer .
